narration:
"Welcome to the world of CVs! Your curriculum vitae is essentially your personal brochure, showcasing your skills and competencies to potential employers. The key here is to understand both the company you're applying to and yourself, so that you can tailor your CV to their needs.

Now, I know what you might be thinking: 'Will my CV get me the job?' Well, the answer is no - it's not a magic ticket to employment. But what a well-prepared and presented CV can do is get you an interview. And that's where the real opportunities lie.

So, here are some important guidelines to keep in mind. First, keep your CV concise - we're talking two A4 pages max. You want it to be easy to read and remember, not a daunting tome that'll put off even the most enthusiastic employer.

When you're writing your CV, focus on the person who's going to be reading it: the prospective employer. What do they need to know about you? What skills and experiences will make you stand out from the crowd?

Remember, creating a good CV takes time, effort, and imagination. Don't just list off facts - really think about how your skills and experience can benefit the company. And most importantly, make sure everything in your CV is 100% accurate.

Finally, keep it simple. No folders, no plastic covers - just a clean, clear document that showcases you at your best."
